title: What is the difference between 13-15 and 12-16 compounds? - Quora

response.answer_text: Group 12–16 compounds are binary elemental compositions (AxBy type) between Group 12 elements (Zn, Cd. Hg) and Group 16 elements (S, Se, Te). A good example is ZnS. Similarly, Group 13–15 compounds are binary elemental compositions between Group 13 elements (Al, Ga, In, Tl) and Group 15 elements (P, As, Sb, Bi) . A good example is GaAs.
